column4: hey, can anyone really quickly give me the mount command for mounting ntfs?  i dont have access to a web browser ATM, and need the opts
mount -t ntfs /dev/your_drive /folder/location
arent there opts needed for non sudo access?
Hmm... You got me there :( I just know that does it :P
i knew that part, but whenever i did it with the -opts utf8,XXXXXX (dont know the last part) it doesnt allow read/write, or non-sudo
Oh hold on, let me get it from my /etc/fstab
defaults,nls=utf8,umask=007,gid=46
thats it--its umask=777 :D
I think umask is for creating files...
is it -opts defaul,nls=utf8..... or no -opts
Hold on a sec... "man mount"
mount -t ntfs -o defaults,nls=utf8,umask=007,gid=46 /dev/blah /place
You want it exactly like that
gid=46 means its part of plugdev
You should be part of plugdev, which gives you read/write access
umask pertains to files being created, and is not intuitive at all, not quite the same as chmod.
er....whats command for group changes
if you want to be part of plugdev
sudo adduser username plugdev
is by default :)  feisty is so....intuitive :D
ntfs rw support is SUPPOSED to be built into feisty, right?
I have no idea... NTFS support is terrible from what I understand...
